children.value: object to bind events to the canvas to interact with 3D objects.
Setting rotation and zoom to a moon object with drag and drop and mousewheel events.

var pos, camera, moon, app;

addEvents(gl, {
  onDragStart(e) {
    pos = {
      x: e.x,
      y: e.y
    };
  },
  onDragMove(e) {
    var z = camera.position.z,
        sign = Math.abs(z) / z;

    moon.rotation.y += -(pos.x - e.x) / 100;
    moon.rotation.x += sign * (pos.y - e.y) / 100;
    moon.update();
    pos.x = e.x;
    pos.y = e.y;
  },
  onMouseWheel(e) {
    e.stop();
    camera.position.z += e.wheel;
    camera.update();
  }
});
The first parameter of each event callback function is an event wrapper object that contains as properties:
) - The x position of the mouse pointer when the event was triggered.
) - The y position of the mouse pointer when the event was triggered.
) - If multiple events where triggered at the same time (like multiple fingers touching a screen), then the array of transformed positions will be here.
) - A method that can be called to stop the propagation of the event.
) - Only on the mousewheel event. A number specifying the delta for the mouse scroll.
) - Whether is right or left click.
) - Available onKeyDown only. The key code number.
) - Available onKeyDown only. The key pressed as a string. Can also be
) - Available onKeyDown only. Whether the shift key is pressed.
) - Available onKeyDown only. Whether the control key is pressed.
) - Available onKeyDown only. Whether the alt key is pressed.
) - Available onKeyDown only. Whether the meta key is pressed.
Creates a set of events for the given domElement that can be handled through a callback.
) A WebGLRenderingContext object. Events are handled for the context's canvas element.
) An object containing the following options:
, optional) Whether to cache the current position of the canvas or calculate it each time in the event loop. Default's
, optional) Whether to cache the size of the canvas or calculate it each time in the event loop. Default's
, optional) Whether to calculate the mouse position as relative to the canvas position or absolute. Default's
, optional) Whether to set the center (0, 0) coordinate to the center of the canvas or to the top-left corner. Default's
, optional) Disable the context menu (generally shown when the canvas is right clicked). Default's
, optional) Whether to append listeners to touch events. Default's
, optional) Whether to append listeners to mouse events. Default's
, optional) Whether to append listeners to keyboard events. Default's
in the callbacks to the specified object.
, optional) Whether to use picking. Default's false.

You can also provide callback functions for the events you need to
handle. The first parameter of the callback is the event object
described

in the
options, then the second parameter of the callback may be an

that is the target of the mouse event. If no target
exists for the mouse event then a falsy value will be provided. The
following callbacks are:
, optional) Handles the tap touch event.
